title: Windows XP: "panic before malloc heap initialized" after installing Windows Updates
body:
by **czarek.tomczak**: 
Hi there,

I have been successfully running Go app on a clean XP machine, but recently I have
installed Windows updates (a total of 65) and now it stopped working. I get this error:

    C:\cef2go>cef2go
    runtime: panic before malloc heap initialized
    fatal error: runtime: cannot reserve arena virtual address space

    runtime stack:

I am testing the cef2go project, a binary demo is available here:
https://github.com/CzarekTomczak/cef2go/releases

Not sure if this is related, but found issue #2323 "runtime: windows DLL mappings
interfere with 32-bit memory allocation".

Using Go 1.2
Windows XP 32-bit.
The binary was created on Win7 64-bit using Go 32-bit version.

I am running XP in a virtual machine (virtualbox 4.3.6), but I don't think this has
anything to do, as it worked fine earlier before Windows Updates were installed. All
other programs are working fine.

Best regards,
Czarek
